reviewText: vary good but the naration was not all that great, could have been longer and more gun,s shown there were a lot not talked about.

A great book for Gun collectors and Cowboy (and Cowgirl) shooters alike.
Lots of information on the guns used in the old west presented in an  way.

This is a very good introduction to the firearms commonly used in competition in the Single Action Shooting Society. It also delves in to the history of firearms development as it applies to the settling of the West. Although there were a few minor technical errors in describing a given firearm, overall the content was accurate. With commentary and demonstration by noted gunwiter and SASS member Mike Venturino, as well as two other active SASS members, it presents a very credible primer on the subject. Too bad it's not available on DVD anymore. Look for the VHS version.
